intro: Cinchonopsis, commonly known as the "glassworts," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. These plants are typically found in saline or coastal environments, where they exhibit a unique ability to tolerate high salt concentrations. Their leaves are often succulent and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid conditions. Cinchonopsis species are characterized by their small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. They play an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various small organisms.
